title: Bisphosphonate
summary: Bisphosphonates are a class of drugs that prevent the loss of bone density, used to treat osteoporosis and similar diseases. They  are the most commonly prescribed drugs used to treat osteoporosis.[1] They are called bisphosphonates because they have two phosphonate (PO(OH)2) groups. They are thus also called diphosphonates (bis- or di- + phosphonate).
